feed.title: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository
feed.subtitle: Security Advisory for Java artifacts hosted at the Maven central repository on GitHub

entry.title: [org.jvnet.hudson.plugins:analysis-core] Missing permission check in Jenkins Static Analysis Utilities Plugin
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Static Analysis Utilities Plugin 1.95 and earlier in the DefaultGraphConfigurationView#doSave form handler method allowed attackers with Overall/Read permission to change the per-job default graph configuration for all users.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-10308
  • https://jenkins.io/security/advisory/2019-04-30/#SECURITY-1100
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2019/04/30/5
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/108159
  • https://github.com/jenkinsci/analysis-core-plugin/commit/3d7a0c7907d831c58541508b893dcea2039809c5
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vvfj-p4jf-j8rm

entry.title: [com.cloudtp.jenkins:paaslane-estimate] Tokens stored in plain text by PaaSLane Estimate Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins PaaSLane Estimate Plugin 1.0.4 and earlier does not mask PaaSLane authentication tokens displayed on the job configuration form, increasing the potential for attackers to observe and capture them.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50777
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3182
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v9w3-34xq-hrjg

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:scriptler] Arbitrary file deletion vulnerability in Jenkins Scriptler Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins Scriptler Plugin 342.v6a_89fd40f466 and earlier does not restrict a file name query parameter in an HTTP endpoint, allowing attackers with Scriptler/Configure permission to delete arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50764
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3205
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xcrr-x93h-rv4v

entry.title: [com.cloudtp.jenkins:paaslane-estimate] Missing permission check in Jenkins PaaSLane Estimate Plugin
entry.content:
PaaSLane Estimate Plugin 1.0.4 and earlier does not perform permission checks in several HTTP endpoints. This allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to connect to an attacker-specified URL using an attacker-specified token.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50779
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3179
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jqr2-7f24-xrgc

entry.title: [com.cloudtp.jenkins:paaslane-estimate] Cross-Site Request Forgery in Jenkins PaaSLane Estimate Plugin
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins PaaSLane Estimate Plugin 1.0.4 and earlier allows attackers to connect to an attacker-specified URL using an attacker-specified token.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50778
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3179
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-g4xm-5mqm-8m32

entry.title: [com.zintow:dingding-json-pusher] Displayed in plain text by Dingding JSON Pusher Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins Dingding JSON Pusher Plugin 2.0 and earlier does not mask access tokens displayed on the job configuration form, increasing the potential for attackers to observe and capture them.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50773
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3184
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q5cj-xf99-79m8

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:ec2-deployment-dashboard] Cross-site request forgery vulnerability in Jenkins Deployment Dashboard Plugin
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins Deployment Dashboard Plugin 1.0.10 and earlier allows attackers to copy jobs.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50775
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3092
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v672-5x3h-57qp

entry.title: [com.zintow:dingding-json-pusher] Tokens stored in plain text by Dingding JSON Pusher Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins Dingding JSON Pusher Plugin 2.0 and earlier stores access tokens unencrypted in job config.xml files on the Jenkins controller where they can be viewed by users with Item/Extended Read permission or access to the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50772
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3184
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wjr6-v4c7-8cv6

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:oic-auth] Password stored in a recoverable format by Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins OpenId Connect Authentication Plugin 2.6 and earlier stores a password of a local user account used as an anti-lockout feature in a recoverable format, allowing attackers with access to the Jenkins controller file system to recover the plain text password of that account, likely gaining administrator access to Jenkins.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50770
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3168
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6r5w-jjr5-qvgr

entry.title: [com.cloudtp.jenkins:paaslane-estimate] Tokens stored in plain text by PaaSLane Estimate Plugin
entry.content:
Jenkins PaaSLane Estimate Plugin 1.0.4 and earlier stores PaaSLane authentication tokens unencrypted in job config.xml files on the Jenkins controller where they can be viewed by users with Item/Extended Read permission or access to the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50776
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3182
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c2f6-rf2r-6j6f

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:htmlresource] Cross-site request forgery vulnerability in Jenkins HTMLResource Plugin
entry.content:
A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins HTMLResource Plugin 1.02 and earlier allows attackers to delete arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50774
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3183
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7ccg-jm7j-4f8v

entry.title: [org.jenkins-ci.plugins:scriptler] Missing permission check in Jenkins Scriptler Plugin
entry.content:
A missing permission check in Jenkins Scriptler Plugin 342.v6a_89fd40f466 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to read the contents of a Groovy script by knowing its ID.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50765
  • https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2023-12-13/#SECURITY-3206
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2023/12/13/4
  • https://github.com/jenkinsci/scriptler-plugin/commit/5addb5f9e68596abdba216e61cf714c2767b874b
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4j42-6xfx-h754

entry.title: [com.jfinal:jfinal] Directory Traversal in JFinalCMS
entry.content:
JFinalCMS 5.0.0 could allow a remote attacker to read files via ../ Directory Traversal in the /common/down/file fileKey parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-50449
  • https://gitee.com/heyewei/JFinalcms/issues/I7WGC6
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7x2g-4jvc-4x6p

entry.title: [org.silverpeas.core:silverpeas-core] Cross Site Request Forgery in Silverpeas
entry.content:
Silverpeas Core 6.3.1 is vulnerable to Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) via the Domain SQL Create function.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47326
  • https://github.com/RhinoSecurityLabs/CVEs/tree/master/CVE-2023-47326
  • http://silverpeas.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gqgv-7wpj-vm6q

entry.title: [org.silverpeas.core:silverpeas-core-configuration] Cross-site Scripting in silverpeas
entry.content:
Silverpeas Core 6.3.1 and prior are vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via the message/notification feature.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47324
  • https://github.com/Silverpeas/Silverpeas-Core/pull/1298/commits
  • https://github.com/RhinoSecurityLabs/CVEs/tree/master/CVE-2023-47324
  • http://silverpeas.com
  • https://github.com/Silverpeas/Silverpeas-Core/commit/9cb2941e9242db3df179c1170d7695c9917e4e9c
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wgrw-fj3v-fhc5

entry.content:
Silverpeas Core 6.3.1 and prior are vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via the message/notification feature.

entry.content:
Silverpeas Core 6.3.1 and prior are vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via the message/notification feature.

entry.title: [org.silverpeas.core:silverpeas-core-web] Broken access control in Silverpeas
entry.content:
Silverpeas Core 6.3.1 administrative "Bin" feature is affected by broken access control. A user with low privileges is able to navigate directly to the bin, revealing all deleted spaces. The user can then restore or permanently delete the spaces.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47325
  • https://github.com/RhinoSecurityLabs/CVEs/tree/master/CVE-2023-47325
  • http://silverpeas.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-42g3-3jwm-63rx

entry.title: [org.silverpeas.core:silverpeas-core-web] Broken access control in Silverpeas
entry.content:
The "Create a Space" feature in Silverpeas Core 6.3.1 is reserved for use by administrators. This function suffers from broken access control, allowing any authenticated user to create a space by navigating to the correct URL.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-47327
  • https://github.com/RhinoSecurityLabs/CVEs/tree/master/CVE-2023-47327
  • http://silverpeas.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vpp3-hpcm-v944
